lenders.name: James Yai Mabuoch
lenders.loan_because: To make a world a better place to live
lenders.occupational_info:
I am the Executive Director,and Secretary General of the Ayat Development Foundation (ADF) a non-profit 501(c)3 organization established June 26, 2004 in Nebraska, Omaha. The foundation is committed and dedicated to provide basic needs to war-torn villages in Ayat Southern Sudan. The foundation's prime purpose is to promote community development, ensure prosperty, foster development, and enhance our public image both in Diaspora and at Ayat Southern Sudan.The Ayat Development foundation visions is to permanently end illiteracy, and poverty in marginalized communities in Ayat Southern Sudan.The Ayat Development Foundation mission is to provide basic education,health care, and access to clean water to marginalized communities in Ayat Southern Sudan and also provide community-based assistant to Diaspora Ayatians.

Our goals
To unify all Ayatians and connect them with their homeland.
To preserve and uphold the image, heritage and culture of Ayat people.
To promote all social and noble causes of Ayat people.
To promote educational and health services at Ayatland.
To promote early child development.
To promote quality education.
To increase livelihood in food security by building self-reliable in food production by increasing agricultural production.
To provide community-based assistant in Diaspora.

lenders.name: João
lenders.loan_because: it helps to create social and economic value where is more needed
lenders.occupational_info: Social and Solidarity Economy

lenders.name: David
lenders.loan_because: Having come from a very hardworking and loving family We had very little during my childhood. I was lucky enough to be born and raised in these United States, and opportunity was always and remains always around. Countless times I have been blessed with someone who listened, offered advice, offered assistance. I remain just a hard working small town single father, with an aging mother who has always been my inspiration. I offer what little financially I may afford, yet also my support from the walks of life I have traveled. Life teaches us many lessons everyday, we must be open to learning. I freely offer an ear to listen, past experiences to share, advice as I may, and support as I possibly can.
lenders.occupational_info: I work as a Nurse, in America there are many males who do such. I have worked as a laborer, I have worked on heavy equipment, drilled oil wells, dug ditches, and many basically hard labor low paying jobs. I have been lucky enough to have the chance to gain education in my field of work, and now I work in a Doctor's clinic every day and absolutely love my work. It can be very hard and emotionally taxing, but I take joy from doing my best to help people who need assistance. I feel lucky to be able to do so and make enough money to support my small family and now live comfortably, yet I never forget the long life of back breaking work, heartaches and financial hardships I endured to get to this lifestyle. I remain with a modset income, an must budget cafefully to pay bills etc each month, but am blessed to have the ability to work and do such, as I know many do not have such a luxury.
